page.title: 11Frant Railway Station
page.content: Frant Station is an attractive stone building. Lord Camden had it built this way when the railway came through his land{100 years ago.} They had to make a new platform because the new diesel trains were too high up, so women with tight skirts could not get on the trains. Every day 21 passenger trains use the line, but only ten stop. The first train comes down at 5.30. It drops the{newspapers at all the stations, and returns to London later. One person works a split_shift 0630-1430. There is nobody later to collect the tickets of commuters and others returning from London. No trains stop at the weekend. For{electrification}the track along the Hastings line has to join to get through{narrow tunnels. The{station is being altered}to take 8-coach instead of 6-coach trains.
